attributes.content:
Architects Anna Mendgen und Dirk Peissl founded **Atelier Mendgen Peissl** 2012 in Berlin. Anna Mendgens expertise lies within conceptual design, monolithic construction and modular building. Dirk Peissls expertise are light weight structures and transparent climatic shells. Together they combine research and practice, engineering and architecture, light and heavy.

Collaborations with engineers, scientists and artists form the basis of their architectural approach. The aim is the creation of innovative concepts, sustainable construction methods and unique architectural spaces. Besides teaching and research at University, the architects recently developed a number of innovative projects. Amongst others a residential building made of precast elements of infra-lightweight concrete and a series of climate shells for kindergardens and schools.

Their work has been exhibited at the Akademie der Künste Berlin, Wissensstadt Berlin, and at the MAXXI Museum of contemporary art in Rome.
